intro: Apteranthes europaea var. marmaricensis, commonly known as the European apteranthes, is a variant of the European apteranthes species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It has feathery leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. This variety is notable for its adaptability to specific environmental conditions and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
